description.value: HL7-defined code system of concepts specifying that a second timing specification is to follow using the repeat delimiter. Used in HL7 Version 2.x messaging in the TQ1 segment.

purpose.value: Underlying Code System for V2 table 0472 (TQ Conjunction ID, version 2.4)

copyright.value: Copyright HL7. Licensed under creative commons public domain

description.value: Version of HL7 in which the code was first defined
Version of HL7 in which the code was deprecated
Whether code is considered 'backwards compatible' (whatever that means)

display.value: Synchronous. Do the next specification after this one (unless otherwise constrained by the following components: ORC-7^4-start date/time and ORC-7^5-end date/time). An "S" specification implies that the second timing sequence follows the first, e.g., when

definition.value: Synchronous. Do the next specification after this one (unless otherwise constrained by the following components: ORC-7^4-start date/time and ORC-7^5-end date/time). An "S" specification implies that the second timing sequence follows the first, e.g., when

display.value: Asynchronous: Do the next specification in parallel with this one (unless otherwise constrained by the following components: ORC-7^4-start date/time and ORC-7^5-end date/time). The conjunction of "A" specifies two parallel instructions, as are sometimes

definition.value: Asynchronous: Do the next specification in parallel with this one (unless otherwise constrained by the following components: ORC-7^4-start date/time and ORC-7^5-end date/time). The conjunction of "A" specifies two parallel instructions, as are sometimes

display.value: This is an actuation time. It will be followed by a completion time for the service. This code allows one to distinguish between the time and priority at which a service should be actuated (e.g., blood should be drawn) and the time and priority at which

definition.value: This is an actuation time. It will be followed by a completion time for the service. This code allows one to distinguish between the time and priority at which a service should be actuated (e.g., blood should be drawn) and the time and priority at which
